oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Altered list of quartermaster's stores
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Robinson, Wingate T., 1832-1903; War use of animals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed and handwritten one-page Form No. 27, List of Quartermaster's Stores, has been altered by Lieutenant Wingate T. Robinson to reflect a transfer of serviceable and unserviceable horses from his Commander, Captain E. W. Bass of Company K, 5th Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, U. S. A., to him--neither being designated to function as a quartermaster for the regiment.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This form is an example of alterations that were sometimes made in the field during the Civil War to the complicated system of military paperwork. Company K, 5th Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, U. S. A., was organized in Nashville in 1862; three companies in this regiment recruited by Colonel William B. Stokes were composed of men from Dekalb County. Wingate T. Robinson would serve later serve as a Tennessee State Senator and Representative.
